intro: Jasonia sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf jasonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and soft, silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
